Del Spooner.Action: Wakes up sweating from a nightmare, takes pills to cope, lives alone in a modest apartment with minimal social signs.
Wakes up abruptly from a distressing dream, self-medicates with pills to manage discomfort or trauma.
Manages to perform routine morning tasks such as showering and shaving despite physical stiffness and minor injuries.
Uses non-dominant hand (left) to shave and ends up nicking his chin.
Calmly prepares for the day (boiling egg, dressing, handling mail), displaying normal functioning despite apparent stress or disarray.
Responds politely with 'Hi' to a little girl smiling and greeting him.
Speeds up and weaves through the crowd to lose a robot following him, showing distrust and discomfort.
Shows disgust at the robot caretaker forbidding the little girl to talk to strangers, indicating some empathy toward the girl's social needs.
Dodges several cars while crossing against the traffic signal, then flips the bird at the traffic light as it reprimands him.
Turns his back on a robot who offers him a seat on the monorail.
Dodges several cars while crossing the street despite traffic signals and throws up his hand defiantly when being recorded, showing quick reflexes and confidence.
Turns his back on a robot offering him a seat on the monorail, indicating disregard or distrust but also social awareness of the situation.
Has a messy desk with multiple urgent electronic messages indicating he may be disorganized or overwhelmed.
Dismissing a citation disrespectfully and storing it among many others, showing disregard for official complaints.
Responds promptly and confidently to a phone call about a homicide, indicating readiness to act.
Hesitates to engage with an old man in a conference room, showing caution or possible uncertainty.
Responds politely to the Old Man's offer of coffee by saying, 'No, thank you.'
Persists patiently with the Old Man to get clear answers about Dr. Hogenmiller's death despite his own agitation.
Maintains composure and persistence despite vague and evasive answers from the Old Man; presses for specific information about Dr. Hogenmiller's death.
Shows signs of agitation and impatience while interacting with the Old Man.
Pauses briefly taking in the scene of Dr. Hogenmiller's body before continuing on, showing composure and respect.
Engages politely and with a hint of humor with Dr. Lance Robertson and the corporate types, acknowledges their status but maintains his detective demeanor.
Steps into a crime scene, notices Dr. Hogenmiller's body and pauses to take in the scene before continuing.
Confidently addresses Dr. Robertson, knowing who he is without needing introduction.
Allows escort robot to lead him without resistance, showing compliance but potential lack of assertiveness.
Directly questions the group about the possibility of suicide, causing visible tension.
Skeptically challenges Dr. Calvin's statement and the group's emotional state with sarcasm ('Yeah. I can see you're all broken up.')
Directly questions whether the old man put a gun to his head and pulled the trigger, initiating investigation with a clear, pointed inquiry.
Challenges the Chief Psychologist by asking why the depression was not anticipated given her diagnosis.
Uses sarcasm to express skepticism about the emotional response of others ("Yeah. I can see you're all broken up."), potentially undermining professional diplomacy.
Expresses determination to have Susan Calvin help him despite others' reluctance.
Refers to robots with disdain ('Ah, Christ...Toasters...').
Questions impact of robots on human jobs, showing concern for others’ livelihoods.
Insists on Susan Calvin's help despite resistance, showing initiative and awareness of the need for expertise.
Expresses skepticism and wariness toward robots, indicating critical thinking and caution in a robot-populated environment.
Quickly assesses the crime scene environment with alertness and focused attention.
Signs the clipboard awkwardly with his left hand, showing a vulnerable or humble side.
Points out the dead man (Hogenmiller) as someone who disagrees with the assumed suicide, showing attentiveness and respect towards the deceased.
States 'I spoke to a dead man today' in a somewhat cynical or challenging tone, showing sarcasm and skepticism.
Questions the apparent suicide and challenges initial assumptions by stating 'I know someone who disagrees with you,' pointing at the dead man, showing critical thinking and skepticism.
Signs the clipboard awkwardly with his left hand, indicating some clumsiness or discomfort.
Engages Calvin with pointed questions about the hologram and the police call, demonstrating active investigation and attentiveness to details.
Makes a sarcastic comment 'This is just how I like my robots—in pieces,' indicating a confident but somewhat abrasive demeanor.
Curls his lip and swivels the robot's head so it's not looking at him.
Asks Calvin about personal interaction with Hogenmiller, probing human connection.
Studies Calvin quietly before turning away to the body, showing some thoughtfulness.
Shares insight about Hogenmiller's isolated and eccentric nature with a hint of understanding.
Expresses skepticism about the apparent suicide, implying he looks deeper than face value.
Mentions missing 'personality' in the scene, indicating attention to emotional elements.
Questions assumptions about the case, expressing skepticism about an apparent suicide and noting the lack of personality in the circumstances, showing critical thinking.
Physically interacts with the robot (swivels its head away and back), showing a subtle display of discomfort or control over the situation.
Demonstrates knowledge of the victim's background (mad scientist, isolated, eccentric) and uses this information to inform his investigative stance.
Asks Calvin pointed questions about personal knowledge of Hogenmiller, trying to probe emotional and interpersonal dimensions potentially relevant to the case.
Insists on seeing the security tapes to verify facts personally.
Is skeptical of the robot and refuses to engage with it, showing distrust.
Points out that robots have led to unemployment and questions what humans will do with their lives, showing concern for displaced people.
Skeptically questions the perfection of robotic systems, indicating mistrust or critical skepticism but not necessarily warmth or coldness.
Acknowledges others' work but asserts the responsibility of others to make sense of the world, indicating a somewhat distant or detached stance.
Engages rationally and cooperatively with colleagues to solve the case, listens to others and entertains alternative theories.
Focuses intensely on the investigation, showing a serious and somewhat detached demeanor without overt friendliness.
Reaches for his gun entering the lab, indicating suspicion and readiness for conflict.
Avoids touching robot parts, showing caution and discomfort rather than friendly curiosity.
Challenges and questions the strict adherence to the Three Laws, showing skepticism rather than trust.
Shows concern by yelling 'Dr. Calvin!' after the robot leaps out, indicating protective instinct towards a colleague.
Draws his gun promptly and cautiously when entering a potentially dangerous area, showing preparedness and vigilance.
Carefully avoids touching robot parts physically, showing awareness of contamination or safety concerns.
Questions robotic laws logically, demonstrating critical thinking by considering edge cases like robots being ordered to kill.
Nudges a pile of robot parts to provoke a reaction, showing proactive investigative behavior.
Is startled by the mechanical insect and the sudden robot attack, momentarily losing control and dropping his gun.
Commands others to stay back and acts decisively to control a dangerous situation, protecting others from harm.
Trains gun on the Robot but holsters it upon cautious approach, showing restraint and measured judgment rather than aggression.
Tells Doctor Calvin to move away from the door to keep her safe during a tense moment with the Robot.
Prepared to use a backup gun as Robot attempts escape, showing commitment to duty but potentially escalating violence.
Dives to protect Calvin from robot gunfire, pushing her to the floor to keep her safe.
Fires at the robot suspect aggressively, showing little regard for delicate handling.
Responds sarcastically to Victor's tactical information ('Gee, thanks.'), indicating a curt tone.
Draws a backup gun quickly and prepares large cartridges to confront a dangerous robot suspect.
Fires at the robot suspect effectively, hitting its leg and attempting to stop it.
Dives to protect Calvin from robot gunfire, demonstrating quick reflexes and protective instincts.
Shows sarcasm ('Gee, thanks') when receiving simple information, indicating confidence and some impatience but not a lack of competence.
Dismisses concerns about preserving the robot for study, focusing on neutralizing the immediate threat.
Helping Calvin up after a fall.
Shows skepticism about security’s control ('I'll believe it when I see it.')
Pushes past security to stop them from firing at the robot, showing urgency to avoid harm.
Runs into the crowd with gun drawn, causing panic and chaos among bystanders.
Expresses intense determination to find the robot suspect and keep the public safe.
Insists on pursuing the robot suspect aggressively despite bureaucratic pushback.
Challenges Assistant D.A. Toller with a sarcastic remark about her financial interests.
Shakes off Lieutenant Bergin’s arm, showing impatience.

Identifies specific distinguishing mark on the robot suspect (bullet hole above the right knee) and instructs a thorough search of retail outlets and repair shops, showing detailed knowledge and strategic thinking.
Commands the team to get the job done regardless of obstacles, displaying decisive leadership and confidence.
Challenges the Assistant D.A. on the legality and classification of the robot suspect, showing assertiveness and critical thinking.
Sarcastically questions Toller about shares in U.S.R., signaling awareness of possible corruption or conflict of interest, indicating insightful judgment.
Is visibly displeased to see Toller and Bergin but handles the confrontation calmly, showing controlled interpersonal skills.
Reacts incensed and a little louder than intended when suggested the case may not affect him.
Reflects somewhat nostalgically that 'good old days' were when people were killed by other people, implying distrust or discomfort with robots.
Maintains composure and asserts himself when provoked (says 'I'm fine!' a bit louder than intended but controls his temper).
Observes robots and the environment carefully while driving, indicating attentiveness and vigilance.
Expresses cynicism about the changing world with fatalistic remarks ('When people were killed by other people.') indicating a potential emotional bias that might cloud judgment.
Steps out from behind a tree to confront Calvin about the robot, pushing for truth despite conditions.
Agrees to Calvin's conditions even though he doesn't like them, showing some respect for her wishes.
Narrows his eyes and questions Calvin suspiciously, showing distrust and confrontational attitude.
Switches to manual driving against advice, enjoying the thrill despite Calvin's concerns.
Openly admits dislike and distrust of robots, explaining his feelings candidly to Calvin.
Shows skepticism towards robots by warning of potential consequences if robots rebel against humans.
Overrides automatic driving system and manually drives at high speed through complex multi-lane tunnel traffic.
Expresses strong personal dislike and skepticism towards robots based on his experience and judgment.
Engages confidently in a debate about robots’ nature and human-robot relations with a psychologist.
Pushes past the Foreman to access the Control Booth without waiting or asking politely.
Walks alone onto the factory floor to investigate the missing robot leg, showing initiative and focus rather than friendliness.
Pointing out the missing leg calmly to the Foreman, engaging directly to solve the issue.
Pushes past the foreman confidently to access the control booth without waiting for permission.
Walks directly onto the factory floor to investigate despite protocol, showing initiative and situational awareness.
Identifies the missing robot leg on the assembly belt, detecting a subtle discrepancy missed by others.
Throws up his hands in exasperation at the identical robots and sarcastically comments to Calvin, 'You're the robot shrink.'
Shares a look with Calvin that acknowledges the impracticality of interviewing each robot individually.
Recognizes the danger of one robot that can harm humans and responds calmly to Calvin raising the gun to his head, advising her helpfully.
Blows the head off the nearest robot abruptly, despite Calvin's objection.
Calls out to robots to not save themselves, prioritizing the test over robot preservation.
Acknowledges the robots' high value sarcastically ('You're worth more than I'll make in my entire life...'), showing a certain emotional detachment.
Immediately shoots the nearest robot to test self-preservation field despite objections, showing decisiveness and initiative.
Calls out loud clear orders to the robots to not intervene, demonstrating command presence.
Randomly stops at another robot and prepares to shoot without full evidence, indicating possible recklessness.
Notices slight movement down the line and locks eyes with the suspect robot, showing sharp observation skills.
Drops to his knee and takes aim but misses as robot escapes, suggesting imperfect marksmanship or miscalculation under pressure.
Presses his back-up gun into Calvin's hand warning her 'You don't know what's going to happen in there.'
Leads Calvin into danger, trying to protect her by motioning her to stay behind him.
Shows signs of fear and vulnerability as his hand trembles and he leans against the wall to steady himself.
Gives his backup gun to Calvin and warns her about danger, showing awareness and caution.
Leads Calvin into a dangerous assembly room trying to maintain control.
Gets trapped multiple times by rearranging lines of robots and visibly struggles, showing signs of stress and disorientation.
Despite being trapped and overwhelmed, he tries to break through and find a moment to recover, indicating persistence.
Recovers quickly from being assaulted and pursues the suspect robot despite personal distress.
Takes Calvin by the arm and forces them through a line to escape together.
Shows no hesitation in allowing the robot suspect to be subdued by police, even though the robot makes a desperate plea.
Avoids looking at Calvin, focusing intently on the Robot instead.
Wants to personally enter the holding cell and interact with the Robot suspect despite orders to wait.
Interrogates the Robot aggressively and disdainfully, calling himself a 'complete asshole' after the Robot's insult.
Reacts with genuine shock and forces a tight smile when the Robot calls him a complete asshole.
Commands the robot to identify and describe images related to a murder, demonstrates persistence and directness in interrogation.
Accuses the robot of murder based on evidence and refuses to accept silence, showing critical thinking.
Detects possible stonewalling and reacts with a sarcastic remark, maintaining psychological pressure.
Is momentarily shocked and forced to smile when the Robot insults him, indicating a brief emotional vulnerability.
Flinches slightly when the robot slams its metal hands on the table.
Amused by the robot naming itself Sonny, shows some lightheartedness.
Presses Sonny aggressively about the shooting, implying guilt without clear evidence.
Hardens expression after hearing Sonny's denial.
Engages the robot in a pointed interrogation, calmly observing its emotional responses and inconsistencies.
Flinches slightly at the robot slamming the table, indicating a momentary loss of composure.
Uses humor to maintain psychological control ('I wouldn't want my toaster to be frightened').
Presses the robot persistently to get truthful answers despite resistance.
Appears amused when robot reveals its name, showing an ability to adapt interaction strategy.
Assumes facts (e.g. accusing robot of pulling the trigger on its creator) that the robot denies, which may be premature and shows some rush to conclusions.
Hardens his expression when robot claims he did not intend to harm him, indicating focused seriousness and skepticism.
Questions the moral implications of a robot violating the Laws of Robotics; engages seriously with Sonny's reasoning about self-protection.
Exhibits suspicion and distrust toward Sonny by implying he might be the killer since he was the only one in the room.
Appears conflicted and reluctant to leave Sonny, showing some hesitation and a rare moment of internal struggle.
Questions the logic behind the robot's actions, showing critical thinking about the Laws of Robotics.
Considers and challenges Sonny's claim of innocence despite being the only one present, indicating suspicion and investigative awareness.
Reluctantly leaves the room when called outside, showing some hesitation or indecision in the moment.
Points a finger at U.S. Robotics, insists the robot is responsible for a man's death.
Opposes immediate destruction of the robot to preserve evidence for investigation.
Points a finger at U.S. Robotics and firmly states that their machine shot and killed a man, showing assertiveness and focus on the case.
Throws up his arms in apparent surprise when Lanning suggests destroying the robot, indicating some loss of composure or being caught off guard.
Recognizes the importance of preserving evidence and argues against destroying the robot amid the ongoing investigation, showing awareness and adherence to investigative procedures.
Spooner briefly catches Calvin's eye and places his hand on her back as she leaves, a small gesture of support.
Shows frustration and anger ('pissed') after the hearing, indicating emotional investment in justice.
Engages in a phone call with Baldez to exchange information about evidence, demonstrating cooperation and trust.
Disagrees with Dr. Calvin's conclusion and shows readiness to speak up despite opposition.
Caught off guard and unable to immediately influence the judge's decision.
Quickly resumes investigation after the hearing by following up with Baldez about the evidence.
Responds to Baldez's call promptly and with concern, showing engagement in the investigation.
Hangs up phone after being ignored or receiving no response when asking who else is on the line.
Pushes past Toller dismissively after Toller says the case is closed.
Approaches Sonny directly and asks for help to clear something up, indicating willingness to work with and trust Sonny.
Calls the robot an imitation and an illusion of life, emphasizing human uniqueness to question its nature.
Stops the Engineers from closing the van door on Sonny, showing hesitation and a protective instinct.
Engages Sonny with probing questions to understand the robot's behavior and challenges its claims intelligently.
Momentarily stumped by Sonny's question about creating art or music, showing a slight hesitation or lack of immediate answer.
Intuitively senses that something is wrong when Sonny is taken away in the van and tries to intervene by stopping the van doors.
Expresses concern about destroying the most advanced robot in the world, questioning the decision.
Refuses to give himself a break despite being told to relax after solving the case.
Rushes to stop demolition robots from destroying Dr. Hogenmiller's house, showing care and urgency.
Pockets the photograph of Hogenmiller and Calvin standing arm-in-arm after noticing the lonely cat next to its automatic feeder.
Shows authority and uses police badge to override demolition robot command confidently, gaining compliance.
Carefully investigates the crime scene, observes details like certificates, photographs, and equations, demonstrating thoroughness and attention to detail.
Pockets a photograph impulsively when startled by the cat, showing a slight impulsive or emotional reaction but also preserving potentially relevant evidence.
Cries out in pain when injured by falling cabinet but continues to scramble for an exit and seizes opportunity to grab the S.O.N.N.Y. plate.
Uses a device skillfully to open a locked drawer by correctly applying it to the keypad, leading to successful access.

Despite the chaotic and dangerous environment with collapsing cabinets and floor, Spooner notices and identifies the important flat metal plate labeled S.O.N.N.Y., and manages to retrieve it under extreme pressure.
In the midst of destruction and injury (cabinet falling on his leg), Spooner is able to recover, locate an exit, and escape the collapsing room reasonably quickly.
Scoops up the scared cat to save it from danger despite own risk.
Drops the cat during escape, possibly due to overwhelming danger.
Approaches Calvin injured and pushes past her without greeting, indicating urgency but little warmth in interaction.
Times his movements precisely to avoid destruction and danger from falling debris repeatedly.
Manages to rescue a scared cat in a dangerous collapsing building environment.
Drops the cat after rescuing it.
Forcefully enters Calvin’s condo despite her surprise, showing determination and urgency.
Insists on the seriousness of a murder attempt on himself despite Calvin's disbelief, showing determination and concern for truth.
Challenges Calvin aggressively about inconsistencies and truths related to the murder case, tossing down a photo to confront her.
Scans his badge before entering the apartment, indicating procedural thoroughness and cautiousness.
Realizes and states that someone tried to kill him, showing awareness and alertness to danger.
Moves deeper into the apartment despite potential risk, showing determination and investigative confidence.
Challenges Calvin on inconsistencies about Hogenmiller, revealing critical thinking and pressing for truth.
Pulls out the photo to confront Calvin and expose her discomfort, employing psychological tactics in interrogation.
Appears paranoid or suspicious to Calvin, who laughs at him, indicating a possible appearance of obsessive or mistrusting behavior.
Comments on the suspect's lack of human-like belongings and suggests fear of people.
Looks at Calvin after her defensive statement but does not escalate conflict, simply exits.
Analyzes the apartment and notes absence of personal life evidence, showing observational skill and insight.
Shows suspicion and wariness towards robots and surroundings, indicating alertness and caution.
No clear actions demonstrating effective problem-solving or decisive skill in this excerpt.
Watches a group of robots suspiciously and wipes sweat nervously.
Notices and passively observes a homeless man struggling on the monorail without intervening.
Observes the environment carefully, notices potential threats or watchers on the monorail.
Wipes sweat from his lip, showing signs of stress or nervousness but continues on.
Holds onto a handrail while the monorail moves, showing physical steadiness and focus.
Grabs the homeless man's shoulder to stop him from rushing at the robots.
Grabs the Homeless Man's shoulder and stops him from making a rash move against the robots.
Pulls the Homeless Man along with him onto the platform, indicating he was protecting others from potential harm.
Feels a chilling suspicion and isolates himself on the platform while being watched by cameras and robots.
Pulls the Homeless Man along with him through a crowded platform confidently.
Feels a chill from the Homeless Man's cryptic warning but tries to shake off the feeling and remains composed.
Notices details such as digital clocks, cameras, and maintenance robots following commuters on the platform, showing awareness of environment.
Waits alone on the platform after train leaves, possibly indicating isolation or vulnerability without immediate fallback.
Despite being shoved onto the train tracks, tries to survive by clinging and bracing himself, showing determination but no indication of warmth toward others in this moment.
Shoves security guards out of the way to pursue the maintenance robot aggressively.
Leaps down a pole and continues pursuit despite injury.
Commands the robot to stop and uses force to try to subdue it.
Sees the maintenance robot escaping, quickly assesses surroundings, and guards, then leaps onto a light pole and slides down to street level to pursue.
Runs up behind the robot, draws gun, commands it to stop confidently.

Despite being hit hard by the robot's suitcase swing and bleeding, manages to fire multiple shots, including one that pierces the robot's breastplate causing hydraulic fluid to leak, then continues pursuit.
Gets knocked down and is unsteady after injuries but continues to focus on the fleeing robot.
Waves his gun and shouts for everyone to get out of the way, causing people to scream and scatter.
Rushes to investigate the Robot holding a specialized screwdriver, showing determination to resolve the situation.
Pushes through the crowd and ignores the owner’s protests to follow the trail of hydraulic fluid.
Fights aggressively and desperately against the Maintenance Robot to survive.
Struggles desperately against the medical robots, demands to talk to a human being.
Expresses distrust and frustration toward the robots administering medical care.
Tries to bolt upright despite severe injuries and being restrained to the bed.
Desperately twisting and struggling against medical robots without calming or assessing the situation first.
Insists on talking to a human being instead of cooperating with advanced medical robots.
Rubs his wrists after release, showing awareness of his physical state and some level of control.
Urgently explains perceived threats and dangers to Lt. Bergin, seeking understanding and support.
Tries to convince Lt. Bergin despite being dismissed and treated as if unhinged.
Ignores the knocks at the door initially but eventually opens the door and allows Calvin inside despite his uncertainty.
Acts with suspicion and hesitation when interacting with Calvin, trying to pull his hand away when she reaches out.
Turns and grabs his coat quickly after being placed on leave, showing decisiveness.
Walks across the plaza early, actively investigates the site of the incident, looking for clues like hydraulic fluid.
Rubs his hands over his face indicating frustration or exhaustion, momentarily pausing active investigation.
Lies on couch avoiding a knock at the door, showing avoidance or possible defeat.
Opens door to Calvin after initial reluctance, allowing interaction that may lead to help or insight.
Attempts to pull his arm away when Calvin touches him, but ultimately stays engaged and attentive to her examination.
Shows vulnerability by briefly reflecting on his painful past and robotic arm without anger or bitterness.
Pulls his arm away and pushes down the sleeve, indicating discomfort or reluctance to openly share his injury details.
Remains calm and composed despite trapped in a car wreck and sensing danger, showing self-control and steadiness under pressure.
Shares personal trauma about losing his arm and admits to taking pills to manage discomfort and maintain credibility, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Reacts with disbelief and attentiveness to Calvin's perspective expressing trust and openness to others' viewpoints.
Starts smashing away at the glass and tries frantically to pull his arm free from the Robot's grip.
Recalls and explains how the robot saved him but left his arm behind, showing awareness of his own limits and past trauma.
Admits to using pills when uncomfortable, acknowledging this may undermine his credibility.
Listens thoughtfully to Calvin's reasoning about Sonny and the case, showing openness to alternative explanations.
Feels suddenly rejuvenated by having an ally; approaches with a sense of purpose and shares information with Calvin.
Accepts and listens to Calvin and Sonny respectfully; engages politely during the meeting in Sonny's holding cell.
Suddenly rejuvenated by having an ally. Strides over to his coat, pulling out the metal nameplate S.O.N.N.Y., bringing new evidence forward.
Appears unsure how to respond or act when handed Sonny's drawing.
Compliments Sonny's drawing despite discomfort with its meaning.
Uncomfortably acknowledges the emotional content of Sonny's dream.
Drops the drawing on the table without further comment after Sonny's teasing.
Receives a meaningful drawing from Sonny and processes the cryptic message correctly, showing awareness and insight.
Remains calm and observant despite tension from Lanning and Robertson's confrontational behavior.
Allows others to intervene without taking immediate control over the situation, possibly delaying progress.
Persistently pursues the truth about a covered-up murder despite pressure to drop the case.
Questions the sincerity of corporate actions, implying distrust.
Engages in a serious conversation with Robertson, maintaining eye contact and standing firm.
Insists on pursuing the case despite opposition and potential futility.
Expresses suspicion about corporate motivations, showing insight beyond surface explanations.
Does not back down when ordered away from the building, maintaining focus on his investigation.
Stops a robotic crew from discarding Sonny's drawing into the trash, retrieves it, and reconsiders its meaning from a new perspective.
Fears robots, points gun at them, panics and fires a shot reflexively.
Shows self-awareness and laughs at his own fear and situation with loathing and self-pity.
Sits down hopeless and lost in the junkyard, disturbed by the robotic hand dragging an arm behind it.
Carries Sonny's drawing and recognizes the building in moonlight, showing attentiveness and reflection.
Hits the counter with his fist to activate the robot at Jiffy Data Storage.
Follows the robot's instructions and cooperates by stating 'Dr. Hogenmiller sent me,' showing trustfulness and sincerity.
Initially refuses coffee politely but then accepts it after a moment, showing hesitation and polite engagement.
Addresses the hologram with straightforwardness and a bit of sarcasm ('No, for Christ's sake, I don't want any--'), showing some impatience or brusqueness.
Steps up to activate an old dusty terminal despite hesitation, initiating contact with Dr. Hogenmiller's hologram.
Engages the hologram in a somewhat informal yet purposeful dialogue to gather information regarding its purpose and the circumstances.
Shows some indecision or awkwardness when refusing and then accepting coffee, which might indicate slight social discomfort.
Listens attentively to Hogenmiller's warnings and carefully retrieves the data stick and nameplate, showing readiness to take on responsibility and follow the advice to rely on himself.
Looks up under the light and quickly retrieves the data stick without hesitation, indicating alertness and decisiveness.
Weaving recklessly through traffic at high speed, clutching an important nameplate and slamming down the phone in frustration.
Questions the hologram carefully to gain critical information.
Weaves dangerously in and out of traffic at high speed while focused on a stressful situation.
Attempts to call Susan Calvin quickly to communicate urgent information.
Slams down his phone in frustration after not reaching Calvin.
Maintains control of his car while being aggressively sandwiched and pressured by two large transport trucks traveling at high speed.
Keeps scanning his surroundings carefully (rearview and sides) to assess threats and options.
Shows visible signs of stress (hands squeezing steering wheel) but still attempts to respond effectively to the dangerous situation.
Appears unsure what the trucks' change of behavior (laying off) means and contemplates accelerating to 230.
Accelerates his car through a small gap at the curve of the tunnel wall to escape being crushed between two trucks.
Maintains awareness and notices the rearview mirror to track the approaching trucks.
Risking his life to evade pursuers, demonstrating determination and survival instincts.
Wrenches the wheel switching tunnels at the last possible second, causing first U.S.R. truck to crash and explode, avoiding immediate destruction.
Holds on through the car breaking up and crashing, showing physical and mental resilience.
Realizes he is trapped by the second truck; kicks the windshield to escape but fails, then forces open the side door and escapes just before the explosion.
After escaping, limps onto the side and surveys the dangerous situation, showing situational awareness under duress.
Makes a daring dash across multiple lanes of high-speed traffic, risking his life to pursue his goal.
Spills out exhausted and battered but immediately orients himself and runs toward the U.S. Robotics Complex, demonstrating determination.
Whips out his gun quickly and confidently presses it to the robot, leveraging his knowledge of the Third Law of Robotics to intimidate and control the situation.
Maintains control by forcing the Door Robot to comply with his demands, showing quick thinking and assertiveness under pressure.
Ignores warnings and concerns from Dr. Calvin, potentially reflecting stubbornness or recklessness.
Insists on pursuing the case despite being told it is too late and the execution cannot be stopped.
Charges through door without caution, getting blindsided and struck on the head.
Insists on pursuing the case despite Calvin's warning that it's too late to stop the execution, showing determination and refusal to accept defeat.
Charges through door without caution and is quickly incapacitated by a metal arm, showing a lapse in situational awareness and tactical judgment.
Smiles appreciatively at Calvin after she stops him from ruining everything.
Responds with humor and mild sarcasm to Sonny's concern (asks who programmed him to hit people).
Offers to help Calvin figure out the mystery of Sonny's instincts.

After waking up injured, Spooner quickly assesses the situation and expresses understanding and appreciation for the unprocessed NS-2 shell switch, indicating sharp perception and calm under pressure.
Spooner makes a lighthearted comment to Sonny about hitting people on the head, showing his confident and clear-headed attitude despite the situation.
Spooner offers to help Dr. Calvin figure out the robot's instinctive behavior, demonstrating initiative, problem-solving mindset, and willingness to engage deeply with complex robotic issues.
Recognizes the importance of the Robot to the case and closely observes the unfolding revelations, showing respect and curiosity rather than fear or dismissal.
Sits down with Calvin to cooperate calmly and patiently during examination of Sonny, showing a collaborative attitude.
Expresses genuine surprise and awe at the discovery of the living brain, demonstrating openness and sincerity.
Recognizes that the Robot is central to the crime and identifies the metal nameplate as the key, showing insight and focus.
Demonstrates calmness and composure by instructing Calvin and Sonny to sit and cooperate.
Shows surprise and astonishment when the robot’s chest opens to reveal a living brain, indicating openness to unexpected facts.
Acknowledges his own prejudice and reflects on how it was used against him in the investigation.
Focuses on solving the mystery without blaming the robot prematurely, showing open-mindedness.
Locks eyes with Calvin and shares his suspicions about the killer robot.
Feels a prickle at the back of his neck about Calvin, indicating mistrust.
Analyzes the scene to deduce that the killer robot took itself apart to leave no evidence.
Locks eyes with Calvin and offers a strategic insight about the real brains behind the operation, showing awareness beyond the immediate evidence.
Places Victor under arrest for murder, acts decisively to protect others by telling Calvin and Sonny to escape.
Immediately assumes Victor's guilt based on his control over robots without seeking alternative explanations.
Trains his gun on the attacking robot to protect others.
Shouts at Sonny to get out of danger, showing concern for his safety.
Trains his gun instinctively on the advancing NS-2 robot, showing readiness and awareness.
Commands Sonny to get out immediately and clearly communicates urgency, taking charge of the dangerous situation.
Leads the group into an area that traps them with security doors crashing down, partially blocking exits.
Does not hesitate when the robot breaks through, indicating confidence and decisiveness in crisis.
Turns to Calvin for help and follows her lead to stop the killer robot.
Races alongside Calvin and shows cooperation in a dangerous situation.
Jumps down from broken window and assists Calvin in climbing down the statue.
Aims his gun at the Killer Robot to protect Calvin as the threat approaches.
Leaps and falls to the ground after his gun is smashed away, showing willingness to take risks to help others.
Aiming gun at part of the Killer Robot to stop it, showing quick reaction and targeting skill.
Leaps and falls to the ground after gun is smashed away, but quickly recovers and follows Calvin without hesitation.
Does not manage to keep hold of his gun, which is smashed out of his hand by the Killer Robot.
Races together with Calvin towards the mainframe room to trap the Killer Robot, showing teamwork and urgency.
Grabs Calvin's hand, squeezing it to offer support when she starts shaking under pressure.
Turns and starts heading back down corridor, focusing on helping despite his injury and danger.
Grabs Calvin's shaking hand and squeezes it to give reassurance during a critical moment.
Turns and starts heading back down the corridor, attempting to assess the situation.
